meanings.definition: A follower or imitator of someone famous or important.
meanings.sent1: The young artist was an epigone of the famous painter, copying his style in every painting.
meanings.sent2: She was considered an epigone of the renowned author, mimicking his writing techniques.
meanings.sent3: The epigone tried to dress exactly like the celebrity, but ended up looking like a poor imitation.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, many designers are epigones of the top trendsetters, creating similar but less innovative designs.
meanings.sent5: The student was an epigone of his teacher, adopting not only his knowledge but also his mannerisms.

meanings.definition: A person who continues the work or ideas of a predecessor.
meanings.sent1: As an epigone of the inventor, he carried on developing the technology that was left unfinished.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was known as an epigone of the great researcher, expanding on his groundbreaking theories.
meanings.sent3: The epigone of the chef decided to add a modern twist to the traditional recipe, much to the delight of the customers.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, successful entrepreneurs often become epigones of their mentors, building on their strategies for growth.
meanings.sent5: The young musician was an epigone of the legendary composer, composing music that echoed the brilliance of his predecessor.
